place.name: TREMEIRCHION
place.gazetteerText: DYMEIRCHION, or Tremeirchion, a parish in the district of St. Asaph and county of Flint; in the vale of Clwyd, 3 miles ESE of St. Asaph town and r. station. It contains Bachygraig, Bryngwyn, Graig, Llan, and Maenefa; and its post town is St. Asaph. Acres, 3, 873. Real property, £2, 892. Pop., 707. Houses, 136. The property is subdivided. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of St. Asaph. Value, £300.* Patron, the Bishop of St. Asaph. The church is good. Dafydd Dhu, who, in the 14th century, translated the Psalms into Welsh metre, was vicar. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
